description.narrative: The Coral Triangle Initiative (CTI) is a partnership of six countries (Indonesia, Malaysia, Papua New Guinea (PNG), the Philippines, Solomon Islands and Timor Leste) focused on practical action for effective management of marine coastal resources to support livelihoods, food security and economic development. The CTI supports regional, national and sub-national efforts to more effectively manage and use marine and coastal resources by: defining shared regional goals and needs; strengthening and coordinating national and sub-national policies and plans; mobilising and coordinating donor investments; and supporting regional delivery of services, including capacity development, training, research and information management. The total value of this initiative is $13.2 million over 9 years, starting 2008-09.
